alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 12 at 2:02AM CST until January 12 at 2:30AM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN PULASKI...SOUTHEASTERN ALEXANDER...SOUTHWESTERN BALLARD AND NORTHEASTERN MISSISSIPPI COUNTIES... At 201 AM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dongola to near La Center, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Pulaski, southeastern Alexander, southwestern Ballard and northeastern Mississippi Counties, including the following locations... Wilson City and Pulaski. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 14. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 18 and 21. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
